benchmark_details.name: FlowExplainBench
benchmark_details.overview: FlowExplainBench is a novel benchmark for evaluating flowchart attributions across diverse styles, domains, and question types, specifically designed for fine-grained flowchart attribution tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation of flowchart attribution methods and improve the reliability of LLM responses in flowchart-based tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: FlowExplainBench does not encompass all real-world variations of flowcharts, such as hand-drawn diagrams.

data.source: Constructed using FlowVQA dataset as a base for flowchart images and annotations.
data.annotation: Initial attributions performed by GPT-4 and verified through human annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated through micro-averaging based on identified attributed paths in flowcharts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate more accurate and relevant attributions between flowchart nodes and provided statements.
methodology.baseline_results: FlowPathAgent outperformed baseline models by 10-14% according to the F1 Score on FlowExplainBench.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated by comparing model outputs against human-annotated ground truths.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personally identifiable information (PII) is used; confidentiality for annotators is maintained.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The FlowVQA dataset is distributed under the MIT License.
